The eighth and final season of the [fantasy](/wiki/Fantasy "Fantasy")
[drama](/wiki/Television_drama "Television drama") television series _[Game of
Thrones](/wiki/Game_of_Thrones "Game of Thrones")_ was announced by
[HBO](/wiki/HBO "HBO") in July 2016. Unlike the first six seasons that each
had ten episodes and the [seventh](/wiki/Game_of_Thrones_\(season_7\) "Game of
Thrones \(season 7\)") that had seven episodes, the eighth season will have
only six episodes. Like the previous season, it will largely consist of
original content not found currently in [George R. R.
Martin](/wiki/George_R._R._Martin "George R. R. Martin")'s _[A Song of Ice and
Fire](/wiki/A_Song_of_Ice_and_Fire "A Song of Ice and Fire")_ series and will
also adapt material Martin has revealed to showrunners about the upcoming
novels in the series, _[The Winds of Winter](/wiki/The_Winds_of_Winter "The
Winds of Winter")_ and _A Dream of Spring_.

The season will be adapted for television by [David
Benioff](/wiki/David_Benioff "David Benioff") and [D. B.
Weiss](/wiki/D._B._Weiss "D. B. Weiss"). Filming officially began on October
23, 2017, and concluded in July 2018. The season is scheduled to premiere
during the first half of 2019.

##
Production[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Game_of_Thrones_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Production")]

###
Development[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Game_of_Thrones_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Development")]

The eighth and final season of the [fantasy](/wiki/Fantasy "Fantasy")
[drama](/wiki/Television_drama "Television drama") television series _[Game of
Thrones](/wiki/Game_of_Thrones "Game of Thrones")_ was announced by
[HBO](/wiki/HBO "HBO") in July 2016,[24][25] and, like the previous season, it
will largely consist of original content not found currently in [George R. R.
Martin](/wiki/George_R._R._Martin "George R. R. Martin")'s _[A Song of Ice and
Fire](/wiki/A_Song_of_Ice_and_Fire "A Song of Ice and Fire")_ series and will
instead adapt material Martin has revealed to showrunners about the upcoming
novels in the series, _[The Winds of Winter](/wiki/The_Winds_of_Winter "The
Winds of Winter")_ and _A Dream of Spring_.[26]

###
Crew[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Game_of_Thrones_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Crew")]

Series creators and executive producers [David Benioff](/wiki/David_Benioff
"David Benioff") and [D. B. Weiss](/wiki/D._B._Weiss "D. B. Weiss") will serve
as showrunners for the eighth season. The directors for the eighth season were
announced in September 2017. [Miguel Sapochnik](/wiki/Miguel_Sapochnik "Miguel
Sapochnik"), who previously directed "[The
Gift](/wiki/The_Gift_\(Game_of_Thrones\) "The Gift \(Game of Thrones\)")" and
"[Hardhome](/wiki/Hardhome "Hardhome")" on [season
5](/wiki/Game_of_Thrones_\(season_5\) "Game of Thrones \(season 5\)"), as well
as "[Battle of the Bastards](/wiki/Battle_of_the_Bastards "Battle of the
Bastards")" and "[The Winds of
Winter](/wiki/The_Winds_of_Winter_\(Game_of_Thrones\) "The Winds of Winter
\(Game of Thrones\)")" on [season 6](/wiki/Game_of_Thrones_\(season_6\) "Game
of Thrones \(season 6\)") will return as director. He will divide up direction
of the first five episodes with [David Nutter](/wiki/David_Nutter "David
Nutter"), who had directed two episodes on seasons two, three and five,
including "[The Rains of Castamere](/wiki/The_Rains_of_Castamere "The Rains of
Castamere")" and "[Mother's Mercy](/wiki/Mother%27s_Mercy "Mother's Mercy")".
The final episode of the show will be directed by Benioff and Weiss, who have
previously directed one episode each.[1]

At the show's [South by Southwest](/wiki/South_by_Southwest "South by
Southwest") panel on March 12, 2017, Benioff and Weiss announced the writers
for the show to be [Dave Hill](/wiki/Dave_Hill_\(screenwriter\) "Dave Hill
\(screenwriter\)") (episode 1) and [Bryan Cogman](/wiki/Bryan_Cogman "Bryan
Cogman") (episode 2). The showrunners will then divide up the screenplay for
the remaining four episodes amongst themselves.[27]

###
Writing[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Game_of_Thrones_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=8
"Edit section: Writing")]

Writing for the eighth season started with a 140-page outline. Benioff said
that the divvying up process and who should write what section became more
difficult because "this would be the last time that we would be doing
this".[28]

###
Filming[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Game_of_Thrones_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=9
"Edit section: Filming")]

In an interview with _Entertainment Weekly_ , [HBO](/wiki/HBO "HBO")
programming president Casey Bloys stated that instead of the series finale
being a feature film, the final season would be "six one-hour movies" on
television. He continued, "The show has proven that TV is every bit as
impressive and in many cases more so, than film. What they're doing is
monumental."[29] Filming officially began on October 23, 2017,[30] and
concluded in July 2018.[31]

###
Episodes[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Game_of_Thrones_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=10
"Edit section: Episodes")]

Co-creators David Benioff and D. B. Weiss have said that the seventh and
eighth season would likely consist of fewer episodes, stating that after
season six, they were "down to our final 13 episodes after this season. We're
heading into the final lap."[32][33] Benioff and Weiss stated that they were
unable to produce 10 episodes in the show's usual 12 to 14-month time frame,
as Weiss said, "It's crossing out of a television schedule into more of a mid-
range movie schedule."[32] HBO confirmed in July 2016, that the seventh season
would consist of seven episodes, and would premiere later than usual in
mid-2017 because of the later filming schedule.[34] Benioff and Weiss later
confirmed that the eighth season will consist of six episodes, and is expected
to premiere later than usual for the same reason.[35]

Benioff and Weiss spoke about the end of the show, saying, "From the beginning
we've wanted to tell a 70-hour movie. It will turn out to be a 73-hour movie,
but it's stayed relatively the same of having the beginning, middle and now
we're coming to the end. It would have been really tough if we lost any core
cast members along the way, I'm very happy we've kept everyone and we get to
finish it the way we want to."[35] The season is scheduled to premiere during
the first half of 2019.[36]

###
Music[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Game_of_Thrones_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=11
"Edit section: Music")]

[Ramin Djawadi](/wiki/Ramin_Djawadi "Ramin Djawadi") is set to return as the
composer of the show for the eighth season.[37]
